attributes.action: Removal of Cameron due to abuse of power & he has breached the ministerial code.
attributes.additional_details:
Shadow minister Ashworth rounded on the PM's comments, saying he doubted Cameron was offering other councils the same access to top policy wonks and accused him of "conflating" his parliamentary roles. 
David Cameron is clearly abusing his role as PM. This surely is reason enough for his immediate removal from government
attributes.background:
Cameron has recently been accused of breaking government rules.
It is alleged that he has breached the ministerial code.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, including calls for the Prime Minister to be removed.

Investigation of alleged breaches of the Ministerial Code is the responsibility of the Independent Adviser on Ministers' Interests. You can find out more here:

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN03750
